entry.title: French SS Volunteer Assault Brigade
entry.content: ... that recruitment for the French SS Volunteer Assault Brigade (members pictured) was promoted through a Waffen-SS exhibition in Paris that attracted thousands of visitors daily?

entry.title: No Toilet, No Bride
entry.content: ... that the "No Toilet, No Bride" campaign encouraged women's families to demand a toilet as a precondition for marriage?

entry.title: her podcast
entry.content: ... that GK Barry said that her girlfriend is used to Barry discussing their sex life on her podcast?

entry.content: ... that Priyo Iswanto used what he called "WhatsApp diplomacy" to initiate diplomatic relations between Barbados and Indonesia?

entry.content: ... that a South Carolina TV station began broadcasting just in time to ring in the New Year?

entry.title: Riley Walz
entry.content: ... that the data feed for a website created by Riley Walz tracking San Francisco parking enforcement officers in real time was shut down by city officials just four hours after the site's launch?

entry.title: O Bêbado e a Equilibrista
entry.content: ... that "O Bêbado e a Equilibrista" was written as a samba to honor Charlie Chaplin, and became a political anthem for the return of exiles during the military dictatorship in Brazil?

entry.title: Madeleine Tchicaya
entry.content: ... that Madeleine Tchicaya declined the president of Ivory Coast's offer to run for a second term in the National Assembly, as she was reportedly "bored to death"?
